meanings.definition: A tool used by ancient Greeks and Romans for scraping sweat and dirt from the skin.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Greeks and Romans used strigils to clean their skin after exercising.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new strigil to help me remove dirt from my body more effectively.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a tiny person using a strigil as a surfboard to glide over a sweaty skin surface!
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as strigils, scraping away the layers of doubt from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the strigil in the sunlight made it look like a magical tool for cleanliness.

meanings.definition: A curved metal instrument used for cleaning the body.
meanings.sent1: After swimming, she used the strigils to scrape off the chlorine from her skin.
meanings.sent2: The shiny strigils in the bathroom caught my eye as I reached for one to clean myself.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to play with the strigils, thinking they were shiny toys.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the room, acting like a set of strigils, cleansing the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the strigils scraping against the skin was oddly satisfying, like a gentle massage.
